titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Imaging or Radiodiagnostic Event - Description

body.p: An Imaging or Radiodiagnostic Event is a CLINICAL INTERVENTION .
An Imaging or Radiodiagnostic Event Â is a test or examination performed, in response to one DIAGNOSTIC TEST REQUEST and relating to one Anatomical Site .
A test counts as one test if one report is issued regardless of the number of radioactive substances used and the number of days on which counting takes place.
It excludes imaging performed as part of radiotherapy planning and Doppler ultrasound examinations without imaging such as those used for peripheral arterial or venous disease or fetal heart studies.
